creator: alexm@w-m.ru
text:
Documentation for <Limit>/<LimitExcept> shows an incorrect example of
access-limit for unusual request methods:

<Limit POST PUT DELETE>
Require valid-user
</Limit>

Actually, "Require" is valid only within <Directory> context.

This should be fixed, and a proper way to deny such methods must be provided.

Thank you,

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Sure. But <Limit> doesn't create its own context. The whole thing must be inside
Directory, of course.

oh, that's my misunderstanding.

sorry for bothering. 

maybe example should contain <Directory> words also, for clarity.
